Review: I have been so afraid of butterflies before but this place has a lot of friendly butterflies. They just come to you. It's so small but interesting.

All about butterflies, they have different pictures and also information about butterflies, different species etc. They also have this butterfly garden in which you can see different colors/kinds of butterflies. Great way to educate children and just near Crocodile Park.
Awesome tour!! Their personnels are accommodating, they are provide explanation and information about different butterflies. Good for children to learn and be connected to nature.

There were lots butterflies to see but only about four different kinds. We had a couple of them land on us too. The entry price was included in the Crocodile Farm and is just a walk down the road from it. You do see that the Butterfly Farm is surrounded by a cock-fighting place. The beauty of the butterflies is worth a look however you won't need to spend more than thirty minutes looking around.
A simple garden, closed off with netting, with lots of butterflies flying around. Spend a few minutes just walking around watching. Can't do this every day...

Review Title: Seedy little place-- but the pretty butterflies all made up for it!
Review: The entrance to the Butterfly House (located 300 meters from the Crocodile Park) is included with the ticket to Crocodile Park (Php 250). The place is small and looks old and run-down with uncaring staff. There were posters about the life cycle of the butterfly but no one was employed to explain.  My sister and I both started to feel as if we've been ripped off but that mindset changed when we moved to the Butterfly garden itself. Quiet and serene, with lots of shade and benches, we watched in awe as swarms and swarms of butterflies whizzed past us from all directions. Beautiful!  In summary, you could easily spend 5-10 minutes in this place. Yes, the butterflies are beautiful but I won't go back unless they improve it.

Review Title: Very few butterflies. Not well kept.
Review: I didn't see a lot of butterflies. The place needs improvement. Maybe add and educational tour or what? Nothing special.

No real welcome at the door, occupant more interested in sticking his pupae to a string. Very rundown, lacks any sort of clean, or investment. There are exhibits which are fascinating, shame they are incarcerated in such a place, probably better to let them free.
It's just a joke. A small garden house with some butterflies. The garden looks ugly with some trees and unknown flowers. Just took 5 minutes to discover.

Although the species of butterfly are lesser than what I expected but the guide was very humorous and made mundane stuffs sound interesting. They even helped us take pictures that made us feel like we are "human butterflies". Had fun!
Far to be a so called "butterfly house"! Few butterflies only in a restricted area, few larvae exposed on a panel, and that's it! No butterflies, no guide, no house!

In this area, you can observe their actions very close. You can also take photographs so this place is nice for photographers that love to capture little creatures and to those people that are very interested for the life of butterflies.
Davao Butterfly House normal park, you may have some information about different butterfly families and it lives. It's good for people who love the neutral life.

Review Title: Not wild, Not Young But Free
Review: Visiting the place reconnects your childhood experiences wherein you do chased butterflies and dragonflies. In this attraction you will be free to see them but you don;t have to chase them for they will hop gracefully near you. Added is the mini children park of...More
This was a nice place to visit while in Davao. They also have room accommodations if desired. A good place to spend the day.

I was with the whole gang... This place is very good for kids and for adults that are interested with living things. My niece and nephews were very delighted watching the butterflies and were more ecstatic when it rest on their arms, shoulders or heads....More

i love hanging out in this part of the city.. close to the river. having a lunch and taking tourist to this spot. the crocodile park is pretty ok. but this butterfly house is so bad maintained. bah.. we paid a 100 pesos to get...More

15 min walk from Crocodile park (no organized transport). Interesting because not many things to see in Davao City. One big place where you will see many different butterflies. Some will land on your shoulders. But we were tired after visiting Crocodile Park. After, difficult...More
It is a small affair but the staff there are very dedicated to their work and love telling you about all the insects they have there - including the Scorpions. Worth a visit.

At the Davao Butterfly House, we learned about how these insects metamorphoses from thorny caterpillars to beautiful creatures of nature. The staff helped us get to know each stage. Live colorful butterflies fly around the garden, making learning more experiential.
enjoyed my trip here with my daughter. I love butterfies - unfortunately, y daughter doesn't (she's scared of caterpillars). Very well kept and clean. Would go back

While we were going to Crocodile Park, the taxi driver told us about Butterfly House. The staff at Crocodile Park hyped about the Butterfly House. It was easy walking distance from Crocodile Park, so we checked it out. The "house" was a tiny botanical garden,...More
Entrance fee to much. Less butterflies .Right now, I have more butterflies in my own garden. It was really disappointing.

My rating was a 3, but that does not mean do not go. Your P200 ticket is good for 3 attractions: 1 Davao Butterfly House; 2 Davao Crocodile Park; 3 Tribu K' Mindanawan Cultural Village. So, definitely go, and take in all three attractions. It...More

Review Title: Was not the best time when we visited
Review: It was a butterfly house but less butterflies around. Maybe not the best time to make it into adult. Some other butterfly houses were so big and much flying around but not this one. Could be better next time if it is well attended to.
There's scarcity of butterflies already in the garden. The entrance fee is not reasonable for a place they call butterfly garden with only about 10-15 butterflies flying around (or less).

A small butterfly house with not much happening i'm afraid. Think I have been spoilt by the many butterfly houses in Australia, Malaysia and Singapore. There is an old playground outside for the children, but even that needs a lick of paint. Overall disappointing -...More

Review Title: LOTS OF FUN FOR THE FAMILY
Review: This is a house of Butterflies-LOL! Lots of fun for the family seeing thousands of different kinds of butterflies. The younger kids will love it.

This place is not very big, and is attached to the crocodile park, but it is set out beautifully and you get to see the stages of the butterflies and walk amongst thousands of butterflies as they fly around your head. Not for people who...More

There's an old playground outside that entertained my son, aside from that nothing spectacular amazed me, I was expecting more than just one single area where they had butterflies I was expecting a sanctuary of butterflies. Smh

Review Title: wooow, its motivates people to exercise potential talents they have
Review: people, its has got excellent customer care, it boosts youths to gain confidence via exploring new sites.. people you will tell more of the stories if you pay a visit to this incredible place, i do love butteflies thats why only its blog, attracted me thus why i paid a visit on this site, lets come and support their facilities.. thanks for your corporation..

I expected a lot that's why I feel quite disappointed with the place. Though I love to see the butterflies flying around you, but the place isn't so attractive. I thought I will see butterflies around a beautiful garden, but the plants weren't taken care of properly. It's quite dry. It supposedly add to the view.

This is just a side trip and normally come free when you go Crocodile park. This is definitely not that enjoyable experience but it should be fun when you are fanciful of butterflies, botany and stuff.
